name: ballerina/http
description: This module allows you to access the http client and server endpoints.

clients.name: Client
clients.description: The HTTP client provides the capability for initiating contact with a remote HTTP service. The API it provides includes the functions for the standard HTTP methods forwarding a received request and sending requests using custom HTTP verbs.

functions.name: init
functions.description: Gets invoked to initialize the client. During initialization, the configurations provided through the config record is used to determine which type of additional behaviours are added to the endpoint (e.g., caching, security, circuit breaking).

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the target service

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: The configurations to be used when initializing the client

functions.name: get
functions.description: function can be used to send HTTP GET requests to HTTP endpoints.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Resource path

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description: The entity headers

return.description: The response record of the request or an `http:ClientError` if failed to establish the communication with the upstream server or a data binding failure

functions.name: post
functions.description: function can be used to send HTTP POST requests to HTTP endpoints.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Resource path

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: An HTTP outbound request or any allowed payload

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description: The entity headers

return.description: The response record of the request or an `http:ClientError` if failed to establish the communication with the upstream server or a data binding failure

functions.name: put
functions.description: function can be used to send HTTP PUT requests to HTTP endpoints.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Resource path

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: An HTTP outbound request or any allowed payload

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description: The entity headers

return.description: The response record of the request or an `http:ClientError` if failed to establish the communication with the upstream server or a data binding failure

functions.name: delete
functions.description: function can be used to send HTTP DELETE requests to HTTP endpoints.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Resource path

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: An HTTP outbound request or any allowed payload

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description: The entity headers

return.description: The response record of the request or an `http:ClientError` if failed to establish the communication with the upstream server or a data binding failure

typeDefs.name: ClientConfiguration
typeDefs.description: Provides a set of configurations for controlling the behaviours when communicating with a remote HTTP endpoint. The following fields are inherited from the other configuration records in addition to the Client-specific configs.

name: ballerinax/mysql
description: This package provides the functionality required to access and manipulate data stored in a MySQL database.

functions.name: init
functions.description: Initializes the MySQL Client. The client must be kept open throughout the application lifetime.

parameters.name: host
parameters.description: Hostname of the MySQL server

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: If the MySQL server is secured, the username

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password of the MySQL server for the provided username

parameters.name: database
parameters.description: The name of the database

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: Port number of the MySQL server

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: MySQL database options

parameters.name: connectionPool
parameters.description:
The `sql:ConnectionPool` to be used for the connection. If there is no
`connectionPool` provided, the global connection pool (shared by all clients) will be used

return.description: An `sql:Error` if the client creation fails

functions.name: query
functions.description:
Executes the query, which may return multiple results.
When processing the stream, make sure to consume all fetched data or close the stream.

parameters.name: sqlQuery
parameters.description: The SQL query such as `` `SELECT * from Album WHERE name=${albumName}` ``

parameters.name: rowType
parameters.description: The `typedesc` of the record to which the result needs to be returned

return.description: Stream of records in the `rowType` type

functions.name: queryRow
functions.description:
Executes the query, which is expected to return at most one row of the result.
If the query does not return any results, `sql:NoRowsError` is returned.

parameters.name: sqlQuery
parameters.description: The SQL query such as `` `SELECT * from Album WHERE name=${albumName}` ``

parameters.name: returnType
parameters.description:
The `typedesc` of the record to which the result needs to be returned.
It can be a basic type if the query result contains only one column

return.description: Result in the `returnType` type or an `sql:Error`

functions.name: execute
functions.description: Executes the SQL query. Only the metadata of the execution is returned (not the results from the query).

parameters.name: sqlQuery
parameters.description: The SQL query such as `` `DELETE FROM Album WHERE artist=${artistName}` ``

return.description: Metadata of the query execution as an `sql:ExecutionResult` or an `sql:Error`

functions.name: batchExecute
functions.description:
Executes an SQL query with multiple sets of parameters in a batch. Only the metadata of the execution is returned (not results from the query).
If one of the commands in the batch fails (except syntax error), the `sql:BatchExecuteError` will be deferred until the remaining commands are completed.

parameters.name: sqlQueries
parameters.description: The SQL query with multiple sets of parameters

return.description: Metadata of the query execution as an `sql:ExecutionResult[]` or an `sql:Error`

functions.name: call
functions.description:
Executes an SQL query, which calls a stored procedure. This may or may not return results.
Once the results are processed, invoke the `close` method on the `sql:ProcedureCallResult`.

parameters.name: sqlQuery
parameters.description: The SQL query such as `` `CALL sp_GetAlbums();` ``

parameters.name: rowTypes
parameters.description: `typedesc` array of the records to which the results need to be returned

return.description: Summary of the execution and results are returned in an `sql:ProcedureCallResult`, or an `sql:Error`

functions.name: close
functions.description:
Closes the MySQL client and shuts down the connection pool. The client must be closed only at the end of the
application lifetime (or closed for graceful stops in a service).

fields.name: failoverConfig
fields.description: Server failover configurations to be used

fields.name: useXADatasource
fields.description: Flag to enable or disable XADatasource

fields.name: connectTimeout
fields.description: Timeout (in seconds) to be used when establishing a connection to the MySQL server

fields.name: socketTimeout
fields.description:
Socket timeout (in seconds) to be used during the read/write operations with the MySQL server
(0 means no socket timeout)

fields.name: serverTimezone
fields.description:
Configures the connection time zone, which is used by the `Connector/J` if the conversion between a Ballerina
application and a target time zone is required when preserving instant temporal values

fields.name: noAccessToProcedureBodies
fields.description: With this option the user is allowed to invoke procedures with access to metadata restricted

typeDefs.name: Options
typeDefs.description: Provides a set of additional configurations related to the MySQL database connection.

name: ballerina/time
description: This module provides a set of APIs that have the capabilities to generate and manipulate UTC and localized time.

functions.name: utcNow
functions.description:
Returns the UTC representing the current time (current instant of the system clock in seconds from the epoch of `1970-01-01T00:00:00`).
```ballerina
time:Utc utc = time:utcNow();
```

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description:
Specifies the number of zeros after the decimal point (e.g., 3 would give the millisecond precision
and nil means native precision (nanosecond precision 9) of the clock)

return.description: The `time:Utc` value corresponding to the current UTC time

functions.name: utcToString
functions.description:
Converts a given `time:Utc` time to a RFC 3339 timestamp (e.g., `2007-12-03T10:15:30.00Z`).
```ballerina
string utcString = time:utcToString(time:utcNow());
```

parameters.name: utc
parameters.description: Utc time as a tuple `[int, decimal]`

typeDefs.name: Utc
typeDefs.description:
Point on UTC time-scale.
This is represented by a tuple of length 2.
The tuple is an ordered type and so the values can be
compared using the Ballerina <, <=, >, >= operators.
The first member of the tuple is int representing an integral number of
seconds from the epoch.
Epoch is the traditional UNIX epoch of `1970-01-01T00:00:00Z`.
The second member of the tuple is a decimal giving the fraction of
a second.
For times before the epoch, n is negative and f is
non-negative. In other words, the UTC time represented
is on or after the second specified by n.
Leap seconds are handled as follows. The first member
of the tuple ignores leap seconds: it assumes that every day
has 86400 seconds. The second member of the tuple is >= 0.
and is < 1 except during positive leaps seconds in which it
is >= 1 and < 2. So given a tuple [n,f] after the epoch,
n / 86400 gives the day number, and (n % 86400) + f gives the
time in seconds since midnight UTC (for which the limit is
86401 on day with a positive leap second).

name: ballerina/sql
description: This module provides the generic interface and functionality to interact with an SQL database. The corresponding database

fields.name: maxOpenConnections
fields.description:
The maximum number of open connections that the pool is allowed to have.
Includes both idle and in-use connections. The default value is 15. This can be changed through
the configuration API with the `ballerina.sql.maxOpenConnections` key

fields.name: maxConnectionLifeTime
fields.description:
The maximum lifetime (in seconds) of a connection in the pool. The default value is 1800
seconds (30 minutes). A value of 0 indicates an unlimited maximum lifetime (infinite lifetime).
The minimum allowed value is 30 seconds. This can be changed through the configuration API
with the `ballerina.sql.maxConnectionLifeTime` key.

fields.name: minIdleConnections
fields.description:
The minimum number of idle connections that the pool tries to maintain. The default value
is the same as `maxOpenConnections` and it can be changed through the configuration
API with the `ballerina.sql.minIdleConnections` key

typeDefs.name: ConnectionPool
typeDefs.description:
Represents the properties, which are used to configure a DB connection pool.
Default values of the fields can be set through the configuration API.

typeDefs.name: Error
typeDefs.description: Defines the generic error type for the `sql` module.

fields.name: affectedRowCount
fields.description:
Number of rows affected by the execution of the query. It may be one of the following,
(1) A number greater than or equal to zero, the count of affected rows after the successful execution of the query
(2) A value of the `SUCCESS_NO_INFO`, the count of affected rows is unknown after the successful execution of the query
(3) A value of the `EXECUTION_FAILED`, the query execution failed

fields.name: lastInsertId
fields.description: The ID generated by the database in response to a query execution. This can be `()` in case the database does not support this feature
